Summary: This is 15 min from John Wayne/Orange County Airport. Just a few minutes from the beach and shopping malls. Even though it is just off the 405 Freeway we didn't hear any of the noise. The buildings surround the pool, sport court and bbq outdoor seating. The free breakfast was a definite benefit.
Manager Response: Dear heatherfeather1969,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about our hotel.  We are delighted that you found our location to be perfect for your visit.  We look forward to being of service to you again in the future!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: The rooms were great! We've been here before, but reserved the two bedroom suite this time. Lots of room with two separate bedrooms and bathrooms attached. Lots of common room space to share as well. The kitchen was a good size. We also loved the outdoor facilities, with grills, a fountain and seating areas. The kids enjoyed the pool and basketball courts.
Manager Response: Dear SonnyaD,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel whenever you're in the area.  We are happy that you and your family enjoyed the different amenities offered and found great value during your visit.  We look forward to being of service to you again in your future travels to the area!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here. Very quiet, extremely clean, and the staff is wonderful.  You get so much for the money you spend. Pool and hot tub are nice too.  This was our second stay.  This hotel is pleasantly close to the beach as well. Not right at the beach but close enough to make us happy.
Manager Response: Dear Bridget C,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your stay at our hotel.  We are delighted that you found great value in our service, amenities, and location.  We look forward to being of service to you again for your third and future visits to the area.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Terrific location with easy drives to many top attractions.  Extremely clean.  Friendly staff.  Terrific room layouts.   Held six of us easily.  Free breakfasts.  Nightly specials.  The night we stayed they had a waffle sundae bar.  Great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear MikeKerrey,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your stay at our hotel.  We are delighted that you had a great experience...We hope to be of service to you and your family again in the future.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: We had a "points/certificate" issue that was handled very smoothly and professionally by the staff there.  Our room was clean and ready for us.  We enjoyed the hot breakfast and the Jacuzzi. I would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Thank you Jewelty123 for the kind remarks.  We take pride in our hotel and the service provided to our guests, and I am happy that you had an excellent experience.  We look forward to being of service to you again during your next visit to Huntington Beach/Fountain Valley!!!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Our room was clean and welcoming. Very comfortable bed.  Breakfast was ok. Please just serve hard boiled eggs and forget the yucky pretend ones! Otherwise food was fine. Service was good - no complaints there.
Manager Response: Dear drinkmilkCa,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel.  I appreciate the positive feedback as well as pointing out the area where w can improve.  We look forward to being of service to you during your next visit to Orange County.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: i happen to stay in this hotel for the business purpose and the staff was good and friendly, the rooms were clean and good, ok. It was overall a very pleasant, comfortable experience. thank you.  Ankita
Manager Response: Dear angelankita,  Thank you for the wonderful feedback that you wrote about our hotel and staff.  We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience, and we look forward to being of service to you again during your next visit.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: I was surprised by the quality of this hotel. Stopped over for one night during a baseball tournament. Very nice rooms, well maintained and generous size with sitting area and fully equipped kitchen. Modern interiors that look recently updated. Friendly staff and decent breakfast included. Overall I would deb happy to stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Steve J-San Diego,  I am happy that you enjoyed our facilities during your stay with us.  Thank you for taking the time to write a favorable review about your experience.  We look forward to being of service to you again!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: What a nice unpected surprise to see an anniversary gift bag on our rooms kitchen table when we checked in. Now thats taking care of their guests.  Real nice clean room. Quiet. Great, well stocked breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Bigcoach6,  We are thankful for the great comments you shared about your stay with us...and Happy to hear that you were pleasantly surprised with your anniversary gift!!!  We look forward to being of service and possibly celebrating other events with you in the future!  All the Best,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Leather armrests were very worn,  chair should be replaced.  We saw at least 8 gnats during our stay, managing to kill just 2.  Front desk said it was 'due to the weather.'  Indoors is climate controlled;  there should be no insect of any type.  Staff was friendly, beds very comfortable, hotel full but very quiet, in accordance with Quiet Policy guests sign on arrival.
Manager Response: Dear BandEmontclair,  Thank you for taking time to write a review of our hotel, I'm sorry that you found our grounds were not well-kept and the condition of the chairs poor.  We are currently working on our Gnat problem with our landscape company and we are in process of replacing the arm chair covers.  We value your feedback and will use it to better our services and product. I have shared your comments with my team, and I can assure you that we do not take this lightly. I hope you will give us another chance during your next visit!  Thank you again for your feedback, and I'm sorry that we did not meet your expectations.   Warm Regards,  Spencer Davis

Summary Heading: If you like to sleep, do not choose this one...
Summary: Based on my experience with Resindence Inn I selected this one. Literally next to the highway, easy to access. Due to long term business travel I prefer apartments from regular hotel rooms. First few stays were great, the last one full of surprises. First night I had dozens of flies in the bathroom. The other night loud teans deciding to play basketball under my windows. Response from receptionist when I complained was unusually arrogant. I wonder whether there is other place around where one could stay for 6k $ a month and have some decent sleep?
Manager Response: Dear MXN399,  Thank you for taking time to write a review of our hotel, I'm sorry that you found our grounds were not well-kept and the basketball court was noisy, as well as our front office staff was not helpful.  We value your feedback and will use it to better our services and product. I have shared your comments with my team, and I can assure you that we do not take this lightly. I hope you will give us another chance during your next visit!  Thank you again for your feedback, and I'm sorry that we did not meet your expectations.  Warm Regards,  Spencer Davis

Summary: Me and my family visited the Residence Inn recently. It is a very clean and they have a super friendly staff. Always helpful with any questions or concerns I had and went out of their way to accommodate me and my family. Will stay here again. Without hesitation.
Manager Response: Dear opilla36,  Thank you for taking the time to write a favorable review of your recent stay at our hotel.  I am happy that you and your family enjoyed our product and services.  We look forward to being of service to all of you again in the future!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: It was a 3 star hotel for sure. The rooms were clean, just a little tired. Newer or pressed drapes would be nice. No elevators for second floor rooms. We chose this place because it was in between LA and Disneyland. There is a pool and hot tub which is hard to figure out from the website. Even has a small basketball court and courtyard to workout a bit. Included breakfast was handy to tank up before going out for the day. Rooms are not connected to lobby as they are all separate small buildings with 8 suites in each building. I'd use it again if I was to go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at the Residence Inn Huntington Beach Fountain Valley. We pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels and we hope we exceed your expectations on your next visit to southern California.

Summary Heading: Can always count on residence inn....
Summary: Once again our choice is the Residence Inn in Fountain Valley for our inlaws visits. Yes it's the same anywhere you stay but what made it our top choice is the people here. They are always helpful and you know they are doing their best. Hot breakfast was enjoyed by all and tastee is what was told to me. Stay here if you need a lil space to cook, keep foods.
Manager Response: Dear Tigerfam,  Thank you for sharing your feedback about the recent stay of your family and in-laws.  We take great pride in the service we provide, and I'm happy to hear that our consistency has shown throughout the yeards during your stay.  Happy New Year and we look forward to being of service to you again!!!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location, good room, great staff
Summary: Spent 2 nights at this hotel on certificate (free nights). Checked in late and requested an upgrade for gold member. Very glad that we were given the spacious 2br/2baths unit with 2 king beds. Very spacious n clean though the hotel looks a bit aging. Love the floor plan.  One star was taken because: No HD cable Pop corn ceiling Location of the unit relatively close to the freeway but it wasn't too bad (still being able to have good sleep) Matresses & pillows are not as comfy as other Marriott.
Manager Response: Dear lee p,  Thank you for the favorable rating and good comments shared about your recent stay at our hotel.  We strive to be the best in our market and your feedback for improvement allows us to become the leader amongst our competitors.  We look forward to being of service to you again during your next visit to Fountain Valley!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: The hotel was supposedly renovated in 2014. The rooms were nice, but they felt a bit rough for such a recent renovation. The carpet was stained and the tub drains were super slow. The pool water seemed a bit off, so we didn't swim very long with the kids.  The service was pretty good except for one incident that I won't go into...
Manager Response: Dear Tripconsult,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  I apologize for the incorrect information that was given to you...Our last renovation was 4 years ago in 2010, not 2014.  We strive in making all of our guests hapy during their stay at our hotel, and we obviously did not meet your expectations.  I would also like to hear more about the one incident that you encountered, as I use this to train our associates in improving our services everyday.  Please call me at the hotel at your earliest convenience.  Thank you,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Based on my experience with Resindence Inn I selected this one. Literally next to the highway, easy to access. The majority of rooms are studios - having the fire-place, well only few apartments have separate living-room (with fully equiped kitchen) with bed-room. This is the one I selected. Room was pretty quiet - yet this was depending on the traffic on 405. Rooms are clean, staff friendly - only the breakfast is rather limited. Good thing is that on some weekdays the hotel serves free snacks/salads in the late afternoon. This can be enjoyed while watching the fire-place in the lobby. In overal - good price for the quality and level of service they provide.
Manager Response: Hello mxn399,  Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback about your stay at our hotel.  We pride ourselves in creating a great experience for our extended stay guests, and I'm happy to see that we've done that for you.  We look forward to being of service to you again in the future!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: If you have a reason to stay in the Huntington Beach area, and it is for a prolonged period of time , this is your Home away from home. The suites are spacious, well appointed , clean and  ideally located. Amazingly, even though the Inn is located off the 405, you do not hear traffic noises. The pool , although not terribly large, it is heated and clean. If you travel with your dog, the Inn accepts dogs . There is a $100.00 charge, which at first blush offended me, but after I learned that they  actually bring in a cleaning team to sanitize the room after the departure , it was more than reasonable .The only slight negative is the "free breakfast", the menu does not change daily, therefore it can become boring over time.
Manager Response: Dear Jefftimb,  Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback about your stay at our hotel.  We are happy that you had a good experience overall, and we look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.  Regards, Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Checked in- friendly staff member. The room was standard studio size. The room was clean and quiet- The 405 was within throwing distance of the building and didn't hear it at all. The breakfast was fine. Both mornings the staff was late getting the breakfast out ( 7:00 A.M. for the weekend). I don't understand why everything can't be out 10 minutes before the actual opening time. The hotel location is central to many Orange County attractions.
Manager Response: Dear explorer1421,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your experience at our hotel.  I am happy that your stay was overall positive.  I will be sure to share your comments with my breakfast team, as this is good feedback for us to improve.  We look forward to having you stay with us again!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Rooms not meant for more than 4 people
Summary: Booked Residence Inn for family trip due to it's proximity to Huntington Beach (5min) and Knott's Berry Farm (20 mins). The kitchenette was also a draw so we could eat in.  The complimentary breakfast was decent and not too crowded.  Those were the positives.    What needs improvement...    1) Check in time is a little late (4pm).  Requested early check in. They said it was not guaranteed. Okay.  Tried to get in early at 11:30am.  Room, not ready Okay, we'll go to the beach and come back. They said the room would be ready at 4pm.  Came back at 4pm, room not ready.  Was 4:40pm by the time we had the keys to the room.  2) The room configuration advertisement.  On the website and my confirmation, the room was supposed to be " 2 Bedroom Suite, Bedroom 1: 1 King, Bedroom 2: 1 King,
Manager Response: Dear AZfamily22,  Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay at our hotel!  I apologize that the hotel and service did not meet your expectations.  It is comments like this that give us the opportunity to improve in areas that we may overlook.  I can assure you that your concerns will be addressed with my team (about the service) and my regional leaders (about the sofabed).  We strive to make our guests happy and enjoy their experience at our hotel.  I hope that you will reconsider us for your next visit to the area.  If you have further concerns, please feel free to contact me directly at the hotel.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: We booked this room for our son and daughter-in-law and two grandchildren who were visiting from Oregon. They were very happy with the room. They loved that the kitchen was outfitted well. The bed was very comfortable, there was adequate sitting area for everyone and it was clean. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was ok.
Manager Response: Dear McCowins,  Thank you for taking the time to write a favorable review about our hotel.  I am happy that your family was able to enjoy their experience during their visit.  We look forward to being of service to them and other family members during their next visit!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Very clean, easy check in and excellent breakfast
Summary: My friend and I had a wonderful night at this property. Great location in Orange County, minutes to the Huntington Beach Pier and Newport Beach. Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm are a few miles away. Lots of restaurants in area.  Easy, friendly check in. Junior suite was roomy and looked like it was recently redone. New appliances for sure. Excellent a/c. Very well done breakfast buffet. Eggs, toast, bagels, biscuits, muffins, Canadian bacon, oatmeal were the standard fare. Plenty of hot coffee and tea.   Very satisfied customer. I will be back and I will highly recommend to friends, family and you.
Manager Response: Dear cabopapa,  Thank you for sharing your feedback about your stay at our hotel.  I am very happy to read that you had a great experience with our services and our product.  I will be sure to share this with my team!  We look forward to having you stay with us again during your next visit to the Orange County area!!!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: This place is dated and felt run down. Exterior hallways to entrances are dark. Walls pretty thin. Don't forget your toothbrush, they sell and do not provide any complimentary. Breakfast was okay, waffle machine makes great waffles, it's time they change their breakfast buffets to something like what Hyatt Place has, morning scrambles, something about these eggs at this location was odd tasting, had a plastic like texture, maybe they need to scramble better. We were in a downstairs unit and the carpet felt grimly, but maybe that's where dogs typically stay and gave it that feel. Not sure I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear AmySD,  Thank you for the feedback about your recent stay at our hotel.  It is comments like yours that give us the opportunity to improve our services and the product.  I will be sharing this with my team so we can work on these opportunities of improvement.  I hope you will consider us again duing your next visit to Orange County.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Best value we've found in So Cal! Great location just off the 405 but very quiet. Pool, hot tub, and sport court are great. Rooms are very comfortable. The only two minor drawbacks are no elevator and the fitness room is small. Fortunately, a 24 Hour Fitness club is about a half mile away.   Love this place and will plan on staying again!
Manager Response: Dear Anewsbud,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay at our hotel.  We are delighted that you enjoyed the services and amenities provided!  We look forward to being of service to you again during your next visit to Orange County!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: This was our last stop on our road trip celebrating our twins 21st Birthday and we were looking forward to some relaxation.  On arrival I was a bit worried when I got to the front as it looked like I had arrived at a Motel however once we got upstairs to our room we were very happy. It was a very large room with a good kitchen and even though  the bathroom did not have a walk in shower and was small it was okay.  The beautiful beach was a short drive away but be warned the parking is expensive if you plan to visit everyday.   Disneyland was only about 30 mins drive from the hotel and the route to get there is very straightforward.  We enjoyed the free breakfast every morning and it had a wide choice the staff who work in there are lovely and very good at keeping everything tidy
Manager Response: Dear shockedelicka,  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about your rcent stay at our hotel.  I am happy to hear that we met your expectations, and we appreciate the feedback on opportunities of improvement.  We hope to be of service to you again during your next visit to the Orange County area!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Like all Residence Inns the FV location is very nice.  Large room, nice facilities.  Our only complaint: we made toast one morning, using one knife and one small plate.  These were placed in the dishwasher by the maid and cleaned.  Given the dire drought emergency in California this was simply irresponsible.
Manager Response: Dear OCProfessor,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  I am aligned with your comment about the water waste and have shared this with my housekeeping team.  I assure you that we will be doing our part to conserve water during this drought crisis!  Sincerely,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Overall a good stay with good rooms and very good service.
Summary: The staff was very attentive and always helpful. The rooms were clean and what you would expect from an extended stay facility with kitchens and large refrigerator . Had a nice court yard with pool and basketball court. This location was extremely convenient to the 405 Fwy and had many local restaurant options. The free breakfast was excellent with fresh waffles, eggs, and fresh fruit .
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay at our hotel.  We are happy that you enjoyed the amenities and service that we provide.  We look forward to you coming back and being of service to you again!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Very nice stay! The room was very clean and had modern amenities. Very nice to have a full kitchen when traveling with a baby. The only small complaint is that the carpet around the bathroom was wet. We weren't sure if it was because the room was so humid when we first got there or if there was a small leak somewhere.  The staff was very nice.
Manager Response: Dear charlz808,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review and rate us favorably!  I am happy to hear that we met your expectations.  We look forward to being of service to you again in the future!  Warm Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: The rooms look just like the website show. We were in a 2 bedroom suite, which is nice, having 2 grown children with us . We did not use the kitchen, but it looked clean & stocked with plates, glasses,etc. the 1st night we got in late & we noticed dozens of little bugs(like fruit flies). I called the front desk, they were apologetic & sent someone over with a can of Raid. He stood outside while I sprayed, I'm not sure it really worked & it left a yucky residue wherever I sprayed. The next day I saw the housekeeper & asked her to do something about the bugs & let the front desk know. I do not know what they did,but when we came back several hours later, they were almost gone. Yes there were so e at night, but much better. The breakfast was so-so, they should serve individual
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice room, nice staff, nice location, etc.  However, one incident that I thought it was weird.  It was around 9a.m. on Saturday, April 19, 2014, a fire alarm went off just as I was shampooing my hair in the shower.  I had to rinse quickly, tried to dry myself as much as I can, put on some clothes and ran downstairs and out to parking lot.  The alarm was still going on.  Neighbors were already out with their families and some with their dogs chit chatting with each other.  Anyway, the alarm stopped and it must be at least 5 minutes.    Everybody went back to their room after the alarm stopped for about 2 or 3 minutes after.  I went back into the shower to finish my interrupted shower.  And what do you know, the alarm went off again as I was conditioning my hair.   So had to dress
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Condo-like suite, great for family in quiet area near the beach
Summary: If you're looking for a clean, modern and comfortable fully-loaded suite that's in a quiet residential area near the beach then this hotel is a great choice. There is an outdoor pool but we did not use. Also, they serve complimentary breakfast and snacks although the breakfast selection was mediocre and under portioned. Front desk staff was nice and there's minimal noise/activity within the hotel vicinity. My only complaint was that their so-called "sofa bed" is definitely not a bed. It was a tiny sofa with a thin layer of egg-carton shaped foam - something one would use to for packaging and not to sleep on. I didn't like how that was falsely advertised! We were a family of three and the third person had a very uncomfortable sleep experience. Also, the room was quite pricey but
Manager Response: none

Summary: I usually try to stay at Marriott hotels, but the Residence Inn Huntington Beach-Fountain Valley really drove me away.  To be clear, this review is based on service, not on a stay at the hotel.  We were heading to Orange County for the day and needed a hotel room in the area.  We had a small dog with us, so we needed a pet friendly hotel.    I called the hotel directly and asked if it was pet friendly.  The reservation specialist said yes, and I booked a reservation for that night.  We arrived at the hotel and went to check-in and were surprised to be handed a pet waiver that stated we would be charged $100 per stay for our dog.  Well, we hadn't been informed of the fee when we reserved the room directly with the hotel, so it came as a bit of a surprise.  Not to mention, $100
Manager Response: Dear Ashley R,  Thank you for sharing  your comments about your recent experience at our hotel.  I apologize that our pet policy and fee were not clearly communicated to you when you made your reservation.  I have shared your comments with my team on how we can improve communicating our services to all of our guests so that there are no perceived "hidden charges".  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Overall the facilities, interior, and location is very good. With free breakfast, swimming pool, and exercise room, very convenient for family traveling. Staffs are friendly as well.  One negative thing is that as these is no gated entrance, there was loud noisy after midnight, not sure it was from the teenage nearby or drunk people staying the hotel. It will be good to have some control.   Another thing is that it will be better if there is curtain can be closed at night to block some street lights.
Manager Response: Dear Junster,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel.  I appreciate the positive comments about our staff service and overall amenities.  I also thank you for giving me the opportunity to improve our handling of noisy visitors at night.  I'm not sure why your room may not have had the standard "blackout drapes", but I will be sure to communicate with the housekeeping team...My apologies!  We look forward to having you again during your next visit to Fountain Valley/Huntington Beach!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Quiet, comfy, decent value for price. Close enough to Disney & other top spots.
Summary: Residence Inns come in a variety of flavours - some are apartment style where all rooms are in one building, others have four, six or eight suites in one building, with two or four suites accessed by one stairwell like this hotel. Warning - No elevators! Vaulted ceilings give this suite a nice touch with central living area quite large and inviting. Both bedrooms are cozy with a good queen bed but not super comfortable like other Marriott properties. Pool looked ok but we didn't use it. Close enough drive to Disney but still a ways away. Close to John Wayne airport. Breakfast was good but small room compared to size of hotel. I would not choose to stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear yvrtravelguy,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about our hotel.  It allows us to deliver consistently on our strengths and opportunity to work on development trends.  I appreciate your loyalty to the Marriott brands, and I hope that we can fully satisfy your expectations in the future.    Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: I relocated from Texas and had to stay at the Residence Inn for a few days before my apartment was ready. It had everything to offer to make one's stay comfortable.  The property and the rooms were very clean, and the internet to do work worked well. I also thought the free breakfast every morning was a great bonus!
Manager Response: Dear 7008LoveToTravel,  Welcome to Fountain Valley!!!  Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback about your stay at our hotel.  I am happy to hear that we met your expectations.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: I am all for writing my positive experiences and it's taken me a couple weeks and much thought to write about this.  Since October my hubby and I have wanted a night out. With 3 kids that just doesn't happen often. My son got us a room in which he booked for a surprise for us. We were so looking forward to doing nothing but grabbing takeout and enjoying alone time in a beautiful Marriott room. When we approached the check in associate by the name of Spencer he was quick to respond that the reservation we had was a rate for employees only. He then responded he had no room for a cheaper rate except for 129.00. My husband and I came with very little money as we drove 50 miles to stay there. When we got turned away I was so sad my heart ached. Here we had take out, wine goodies for
Manager Response: Dear Dana H,  Thank you for sharing your feedback...  I regret that we were not able to accommodate you at the discounted rate that you were expecting.  Just to clarify, the "Marriott Associate Holiday" rate that your reservation was set up for applied to Marriott associates only.  This is a privelege offered to all Marriott associates to enjoy during the holidays, and it is clearly stated that only Marriott associates can avail of this discounted rate.  I apologize if we or the Marriott associate you are associated with did not clearly explain this to you prior to check-in.  Please feel free to contact me should you have further questions.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent staff; good place to stay
Summary: This is the first time I have stayed in a 'residence' inn and I was pleasantly surprised.  Our two bedroom suite was very clean and spacious, although I would have preferred more room in the dining/sitting area and less in the bedrooms.  There were enough dishes and pots for four, with a note to call the front desk should anything more be required.    The staff was wonderful; check-in was quick and easy.  We were able to get into our room early - which was nice after a long day's drive.  I contacted the desk three times with questions and requests and each time, the response was polite, cheerful and quick.    The outdoor sitting area with bbq was an unexpected treat.  A gentle fountain, lots of comfortable chairs and umbrellas for shade gave a nice area for relaxing.  While we
Manager Response: Dear gail_2616,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience of your stay at our hotel.  The team and I take great pride in delivering the services and products that Marriott is known for.  I am happy that we made a good first impression on your first time with the Residence Inn by Marriott.  May you have many more great experiences with our brand.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Still a great place to stay.
Summary: Have stayed at the Fountain Valley Residence Inn for many years.  It is still well maintained and updated after all of the years (20+) that I have stayed at this hotel.  Staff is very helpful and always friendly.  Great place to stay and located within easy drive to all of the Orange County attractions.  I will definitely return.
Manager Response: Dear Phillip C,  Thank you for your loyalty in staying at our hotel for all these years!  It makes us all smile when we hear that we are taking care of our guests with Marriott's "Spirit to Serve" on a consistent basis.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to Orange County!!!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: I love this hotel - freeway close (right off Brookhurst) and right down the street from Mile Park where you can walk, job, bike or people watch. It's a little home away from home. Very convenient shopping nearby. If you need to be in this area for work or pleasure I would highly recommend it!
Manager Response: Dear Donna Y,  Thank you for taking the time to write a favorable review about our hotel.  I am happy to hear that you were pleased with the location of the hotel and our services made you feel at home.  We look forward to having you again on your next trip!  Warm Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: We chose this place as a midpoint between picking up daughter from CSU, Long Beach and Mission Viejo where extended family lives.  Very easy access from freeway, and we did not hear any freeway noise (although we were closer to the street than to the freeway).  We stayed for 3 days/2 nights in a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite with a sitting room/kitchen between the rooms to allow us and our college daughter privacy during the evening/night.  Lots of conveniences and local restaurants closeby; drive to Huntington Beach/Pier to further see the southern California lifestyle was 15 minutes away. The suite had high showerheads, comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs in each bedroom plus sitting area, and the kitchen area had all the amenities of being in a kitchen at home.  The countertop had
Manager Response: Dear Disneylovers,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let everyone know about your stay at our hotel.  It is comments like yours that make the team proud and happy to serve our guests.  I am happy to hear that you had a great experience...We look forward to serving you again on your next visit to Orange County.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Dated property, service lacking, grounds dirty
Summary: Disappointed in this property. Other Residence Inns have been wonderful. Suite was ok but housekeeping slow. Left room early each day, returned by mid-afternoon to an unclean room. At check in, I asked hotel to split the bill between me and a friend. They did not do this. I checked out alone and was charged way more than my share of the bill creating an awkward situation. The grounds could be kept cleaner. Trash and dog feces were not picked up. This is an older property. No elevator, accessed room from the outside. We were on the top floor but it was still noisy. Only consolation was a lovely manager named Tiffany who did her best to make things right post stay.
Manager Response: Dear williesmom237,  Thank you for taking time to write a review of our hotel, I'm sorry that you found our grounds were not well-kept and service was slow.  We value your feedback and will use it to better our services and product. I have shared your comments with my team, and I can assure you that we do not take this lightly.  I hope you will give us another chance during your next visit!  Thank you again for your feedback, and I'm sorry that we did not meet your expectations.   Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Residence Inn in FV is the perfect place...just like the other reviewers it is a home away from home. Rooms are spacious and updated.  Pools, outdoor lounging and breakfast area all beautiful and welcoming.  Free parking.  Free breakfast - basic continental stuff, but acceptable.  Location is situated close to everything - grocery stores, restaurants, freeway & parks.  It is the perfect stay if you are visiting Huntington Beach/OC area.
Manager Response: Thank you honeyloveoc for the generous feedback!  I am happy that the staff, facilities, and amenities were able to take care of you and your family. We look forward to your next stay with us!!!  Regards, Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: My wife was attending a workshop in Huntington beach and as Elite Members, we had 3 Marriott certificates to burn so our stay was free, not even taxes were charged. Location is good for access to long beach and Huntington beach if you have a car, parking is free. Good places to eat and beaches within a few miles. Public parking at the beaches in town was $1.50/hour further out was free. Our studio Room was very spacious and clean, had a full kitchen, desk for working, large comfortable bed and good sized bathroom. Nothing fancy, but would be good for work or a budget friendly place to stay and do Disney, Newport beach, long beach and the Queen Mary and just hanging out at Huntington beach which is a really cool area (beach and downtown). Free breakfast was good and filling,
Manager Response: Dear KmartRaleigh_NC,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay at our hotel.  I appreciate the favorable review and allowing other visitors to read about what they can experience at the Residence Inn by Marriott.  We look forward to being of service to you again on your next visit.  Warm Regards, Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Everything we read about this hotel was right on. Though it was our wedding anniversary weekend and we had to bring along the kids at the last minute and the hotel could not accommodate our request to upgrade to two bedroom suite, everything went smooth. Location is convenient to beaches, which we enjoyed, and grounds were clean and not crowded. The only glitch we encountered was at check-in where we were given a room whose door did not lock properly. We soonafter mentioned it to a person at the front desk, who seemed to know which room we were talking about, which made us wonder why the door hadn't been fixed and we were still given a room with an unsafe door. That said, we requested and were politely granted another room by the friendly, albeit young, front desk staff though
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Home Away From Home For Two Weeks
Summary: We were forced out of our digs in Huntington Beach by a flood (broken water line) from an adjacent Condo and so stayed here for two weeks while clean was underway. Breakfast foods were basic and adequate but we enjoyed the people watching more than anything. From careful eaters to basic slobs stuffing their faces. Quite interesting and often amusing. Made me glad that my Mom taught me basic etiquette! TV had basic channels and we could watch KCAL-TV which has been blocked by TimeWarner Cable for the past month due to issues with programming fees. Bed quality was average, A/C kept us cool and kitchen was useful. Maid service was excellent. We didn't try dinner as we ate our dinner meals at nearby restaurants. Parking was plentiful and we could usually find a spot directly in
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at several Residence Inns. This was the smallest room size I've seen in a suite hotel. The sofa bed had nothing supporting the mattress when the bed was opened. The mattress itself was stained and filthy. The room had no bedding for the sofa bed. Two calls to the desk, late at night, finally resulted in bedding but no pillow. A third call for a pillow was answered but no pillow was ever delivered.   The bathroom had bugs. The room had inadequate storage--no place to put suitcases etc.   One night was enough for us and we checked out in the morning.  The hotel is very near a major freeway, has minimal parking and is not that close to Huntington Beach. This is a place where I won't be returning.
Manager Response: Dear desertdad67,  Thank you for taking time to write a review of our hotel, I'm sorry that you found our hotel location and guest room sofa bed condition disappointing.  We value your feedback and will use it to better our services and product.  Every year, we invest lots of money to improve our hotel, and it is comments like yours that help us to identify where we need to spend.  Thank you again for your feedback, and I'm sorry that we did not meet your expectations.

Summary: We spent one night at this Residence Inn, traveling with two toddlers.  The staff was wonderful; friendly and prompt.  We stayed in a one bedroom unit, which has a sleeper sofa in the living room.  This was perfect for us.  Everything was great except for one thing.......the beds, both the king size and the sofa sleeper, are in need of replacement.  We found the mattresses to be uncomfortable and the pillows small and flat.    If new bedding finds its way to this hotel, we will certainly stay again.
Manager Response: Dear restls,  Thank you for taking the time to write about our hotel. We appreciate your comments and we will certainly use them to improve as our goal is to provide an extraordinary stay for our guests. We hope to see you again!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at many Residence Inns, and they all have either a separate building that does not allow pets OR rooms set aside that are "pet free" - which we have always requested since I have pet allergies/asthma.  This is the first Residence Inn that has told me that they don't do this.  They said that the best they could do was put me in a room that hasn't had a pet in it for a while.  I decided to keep the reservation anyway and risk it.  Luckily when the time came, I did NOT have any real allergy problems with the room. The 2 bedroom was great, nice hotel.  Good location.  Free breakfast.  We had a nice stay. But I do wish that they would consider doing what the other Residence Inns have done for their customers with allergies.
Manager Response: Dear Stephanie011,  Thank you for taking the time to write a favorable review about your recent stay at our hotel. We appreciate your comments and we will certainly use them to improve as our goal is to provide an extraordinary stay for our guests. We hope to see you again!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: It is one of the few in the area that offers two bedrooms.  The bedrooms are big enough, each with a TV.  Beds are relatively comfortable.  The kitchen offers bare essentials, but enough so you can cook a meal.  They do offer hot breakfast and a lite dinner most days.  The meal quality is average, but it's handy.  The "living room" is quite small, but has a TV and a work station for your computer.  WiFi is complimentary and works well. Staff is friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear harding3,  Thank you for talking the time to write a favorable review about your recent stay with us.  It is comments like yours that drive and remind us to keep doing what we're best at, and look for the opportunities to improve on.  I value and appreciate your time and feedback!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for a weekend beach trip!
Summary: We just returned from a weekend getaway to a couple of beaches and stayed at this residence inn 2 nights. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. It's not to far from Huntington Beach and Seal Beach. Compared to other residence inn hotels, this is now one of my favorites. Why? Let me tell you: we stayed in a studio unit (king size bed and sofa bed) and it was very roomy, bathtub/toilet room wasn't tiny (can easily move around in there to change), long counter space by the sink bathroom (very helpful when you have toothbrushes, combs, makeup, hair clips, etc...). Our unit was clean and the bed comfortable. Kitchen was perfect to hold our snacks and prepare lunch. We're definitely going to stay here again.   TIP: there are no elevators to the second floor. If this is an inconvenience
Manager Response: Dear Julie R,  I am happy that you found our hotel to be the perfect place to stay for your weekend getaway.  Thank you for taking the time to share your kind feedback and the experience that you had at our hotel.  I am familiar as to how hot it can get in Bakersfield during the summer, so my team and I look forward to seeing you again soon and providing the Marriott Spirit to Serve!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Checked in here to meet up with some friends in the area.  Great location, SUPER friendly staff...EVERY staff I encountered was friendly and accommodating and helpful!!!  Pros:  Nice grounds, solid breakfast spread (pretty packed, but they opened the conference room for additional seating which is nice!), friendly helpful staff, good location, large rooms, lots of room outside for your kids to run around!!  Cons:  Rooms aren't bad, the kitchens have been updated with granite, etc.  The rest of the room just seemed a little bit tired...it's not bad...just "tired"...(I had just come from a brand new Residence Inn).  Would stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Teresa K,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience along with pros and cons feedback about our hotel.  I am happy that you had a great experience and will be back to stay with us again.  My team and I look forward to being of service to you again!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: My two teenage sons, husband and I stayed here for two weeks while we were waiting to move into our new home.  We stayed in a one room studio with pull out sofa bed and were very comfortable.  I was able to cook meals, work out in their gym, have a full breakfast and a nice complimentary meal with wine or beer three nights out of the week.  The staff was what really made our stay though.  Each day we were met by people going beyond their typical duties trying to make us feel comfortable.  Thanks again for making us feel at home!
Manager Response: Dear margarita1965,  Thank you for choosing the Residence Inn by Marriott - Fountain Valley, CA as your "home away from home"...and I am delighted to hear that my team provided that type of service for you and your family.  I am happy to share your feedback with my team, and I thank you for putting a smile on our face with your kind comments.  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Roomy but not in Huntington beach
Summary: Had 2night stay for Disney trip -room was really roomy and comfy but I would not say this is Huntington beach area  Easy access to 405 but didnt hear much loud noise from freeway  Breakfast was pretty solid - waffle, bagel, egg... -breakfast was better than spring hill  Pretty clean -but I can see gabege here and there, especially pool area -they really need clean pool area but room was clean enough  They did little upgrade on room (new color, new kitchen...) but somehow you can still tell this is old property  We would like to stay here again because having a kitchen is big plus with kids
Manager Response: Dear lovehawaiigirl,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay at our hotel.  I appreciate all the positive comments that you spoke of, and I'm happty to hear that you would stay with us again.  Although our physical address is in Fountain Valley, the hotel is the closest lodging establishment in the area to the city and state beaches (aside from the beachfront full service resort hotels).  We look forward to being of service to you and your family again!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks- perfect location for Disney & Huntington beach.  Staff very helpful & friendly.   The pool & basket ball court was great for kids.  A family oriented place/ would come back again.
Manager Response: Dear Georgi2003,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  I am happy that the hotel was centrally located for you and your family, and you found our facilities to be perfect for your kids.  Our team takes great pride in providing excellent service, and I am delighte that you experienced that.  We look forward to providing you the same service during your next sevice!  Regards,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Having lived in the Fountain Valley/Huntington Beach area for over 30 years, I knew just where I wanted to stay when I brought my nephews to Southern California for a Disneyland visit.  This Residence Inn is farther away from Disneyland than its other properties, but we only were doing Disney one day.  Its location, right next to the 405 freeway, made it very convenient to get to all the other places we wanted to visit on our trip, such as Seal Beach, Huntington Beach and the LA Zoo.  We had a 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom unit near the sports court.  It was just perfect for 2 adults and two children (and would have accommodated two more on the sofa bed, but we didn't  need it).  There are supermarkets and a 99-cent store within a couple of blocks so we could get groceries and
Manager Response: Dear HappySnaps,  Thank you for recognizing the hotel and my team with your compliments shared here on Tripadvisor!  We take great pride in the Marriott service we provide to each and every guest.  I will make sure to share this with my team and ackowledge the Engineering associate that made your kids smile with the "High Fives"!  We look forward to being of service to you again!  High Five,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: What an inexpensive way to treat ourselves !
Summary: We have stayed in the nearby Newport Coast Marriott Villas several times.  This time we tried Fountain Valley and we were quite pleased.  The location is not by the ocean, but is quite convenient to LA and further south.  The AAA discount helped to make our stay approximately $175 per night, often the price of one mediocre hotel room.  For the 3 of us, this was perfect.  The 2 bedroom suite is lovely, not luxurious, but beyond our expectations.  Fully equipped kitchen, 2 full bathrooms.  One minor problem:  the chairs at the breakfast counter should be stools, not ordinary height chairs.  Some higher level stools would work much better.  There is even a complimentary breakfast and manager's snacks on certain days.  The pool and jacuzzi were nice - and always empty and inviting!
Manager Response: Dear Cheryl103,  On behalf of the entire team, thank you for taking the time to write a favorable review about your recent stay at our hotel.  I am happy that our facilities and the service stood above your expectations.  We look forward to your return and any referrals that you bring to the Residence Inn - Fountain Valley.  We take pride in providing all of our guest's a memorable experience!  Sincerely,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Very nice rooms with wonderful full, hot breakfast daily, with some variety from day to day. Every day there was a  good assortment of cereals including hot oatmeal, bagels, toast, waffles, scrambled eggs, yogurt, etc.  A special treat was the evening social hour a few evenings while we were there.  One evening there was soup & salad available.  Another evening cheeseburgers, potato chips & salad.  Both evening there was red or white wine, beer & lemonade. Pool was nice & warm and there is a nice outside gathering area with a barbecue, couches, easy chairs & tables & chairs.  We were traveling with 4 generations of family and required 2 rooms. The clerk suggested we have the rooms keyed the same, which was a wonderful idea, so we had a total of 4 keys to open both rooms.  One of
Manager Response: Thank you MichiganAnnieM925 for your kind remarks!  I am happy to hear that my team made your recent stay a great experience.  I look forward to sharing your feedback with them, as they work hard to keep all of our guests happy!!!  We look forward to having you again in our hotel!  Sincerely,  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary Heading: Righ Place at the right price
Summary: Hotels are getting very pricey in this area so we were pleased to find this property.  It is an older design that has been updated to keep pace with business needs.  We found the condition to be great, staff to be extremely good at their jobs!.  Location is about 5 miles north of the SNA airport very close to the 405.  Traffic could be an issue if you have to travel to Irvine in rush hour.  Either way, we would be happy to return as guests.
Manager Response: Robert T,  I was delighted to read your kind feedback, especially the Title line.  My team and I pride ourselves in making our guest's stay the best value for your trip, whether it be business or leisure.  We look forward to your next visit and creating the same experience for you!  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: I recently stayed at the Residence Inn and have stayed there on many previous trips to Southern California. First hand experience tells me that the staff is very concerned with guest safety and security. Thank you to the manager, Mr. Aquino, for his thoughtful response to questions I had; I felt like a valued guest. We always enjoy Residence Inn breakfasts and this breakfast room seemed particularly clean and well stocked. Despite the easy access to the 405, I have never had any freeway noise disturb my sleep. I was able to use the computer in the lobby to quickly keep up with email. I think the studio rooms are a good value for a short stay, but when I need 2 beds for my family or wish to ensure that no one sleeps on a sofa bed (of course regular beds are more comfortable!),
Manager Response: Karen K,  Thank you for your kind remarks and outstanding rating of our hotel.  My team and I know what it's like to be away from home, and that is why we pride ourselves in the service that we give to all our guests.  We look forward to being of service again to you on your next stay at the Residence Inn - Fountain Valley!  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: We just returned from a week's stay during spring break.  We reserved a two bedroom unit.  The receptionist suggested the building (19) next to us as being most convenient and farthest from the 405 freeway.  He was spot on as we did not hear any noise from the freeway.  Yes, some noise from the road out front (Slater), but nothing significant that disturbed our sleep!    The area which breakfast is served in is small, so it can get crowded during peak times, however the staff open a small conference room when available to provide additional seating.  There are only a few hot trays for food so they can run out quickly, however the staff worked hard at refilling as quickly as possible. We look forward to being of service to you again on your next visit!  Art Aquino General Manager

Summary: Recently my husband and I enjoyed a one night stay at the Residence Inn while my house was under construction. The front desk was extremely helpful and friendly. The room looked to be recently renovated and was very comfortable. This hotel is my hotel of choice when I am forced out of my house due to construction or painting.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great  stay close to family in Fountain Valley.   Close to Disney, beach and malls.  Rooms like apartments - very comfortable and clean..  We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom which was great for a couple - not having to share the bathrooms, as they are small.    Free breakfast not quite up to other Residence inns where I've stayed. They ran out of food early and room too small for the size of the complex, since many families with children stay here.   Overall nice stay and good location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I were celebrating his mom's birthday this weekend and we decided to stay at this Residence Inn.  The rooms were very clean and well maintained.  Ask for extra shampoo and conditioner - the very tiny containers of Paul Mitchell were not enough for one person's hair.  The check in was pleasant and the grounds were well maintained.  Breakfast was just OK - standard fruit, muffins, "fake" eggs, greasy sausage patties, make your own waffles, cereal, coffee, etc....so you could have healthy breakfast of fresh fruit and raisin bran cereal.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent two nights here recently due to having to have our house fumigated.  The staff was great and the two bedroom unit very comfortable and well maintained.  We especially enjoyed the breakfast and happy hour.  Used the exercise room a bit and although small, adequate for my needs.  Pool area was clean and pool was heated in spite of being winter.  Will recommend to others and stay again if necessary.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good stay, great service for nighttime arrivals
Summary: I stayed at the Residence Inn, and was very impressed with the service I received and the quality of the room. I arrived late at night and the person at the desk (I believe Adam or Alex) was so helpful in making my stay more comfortable. It was especially helpful that the hotel has put together a packet of nearby food and shopping.   The man at the desk in the morning was also very helpful in helping me get to my final destination and checking out.   My studio was large and comfortable.  I would be happy to stay here again if I ever found myself back here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent 4 nights here while visiting Mom for Christmas. The location is very convenient, just a block or so off the 405. We flew into LAX and found it easy to get to with minimal navigation, about 35 minutes at 3:00pm. The breakfast every morning varied, with scrambled eggs and sausage patties the standard and potatoes, bisquits and sausage gravy(very tasty), french toast, egg mcmuffins as a variety on different days. They also had a nice assortment of cereals, fruit, yogurt and pastries. On 3 of the evenings they had dinner from 5:30 - 7:00. We ate the hamburgers on BBQ night and were pleasantly surprised. Even more surprising was the beer on tap and a very nice Cabernet. Even though we arrived late for dinner, they put out more food at about 6:55. Very quite hotel, lots of
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, excellent rooms and wonderful service!
Summary: The location is great for quick entry to the 405 and only minutes from John Wayne!  Not sure of the age of the location but my room was completely brand new...the kitchen, the bathroom, etc.  My room was very near the back of the property and the interstate...but I heard NOTHING!! Highly recommend...the breakfast and staff were great too.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Home away from Home- Great Suburban location just of I-405
Summary: Very good location close to the I-405 and central to Orange County. Also, close to the Orange County airport. What I really liked about this hotel is that it in a subarban area  with low traffic and a the mile long park nearby. Breakfast and the heated pool was a a hit with the kids.  They also have free dinner on Mondays, Tuesday and Wednesdays. Hotel room was very good with fully equipped kitchen. Overall, a great way to feel somewhat at home when travelling.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just spent a week at this hotel in a 2 bedroom suite. Yes, the hotel is older and it shows in a few places even though it has been rehabbed and the kitchen seems fairly new.  However, it was very quiet during our stay, good to have breakfast every morning, and the staff was excellent. Very kind and friendly and our room was very clean.  The beds are a bit hard from what I am used to, but still slept OK.  Just a comment about the previous review about sand in the bathtub- there was a rough texture on the bathtub surface to keep from slipping, and it does feel a bit like sand at first.  I think this is what the reviewer noticed.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again if we are in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't let its location next to the freeway scare you
Summary: Rooms are large and insulated against all noise - and the two-bedroom suites are beautiful. My extended family stayed here for summer vacation, and we could not stop raving about the place. If you are traveling with family or are staying for a while, this is a perfect location. The hotel offers free breakfast and an evening happy hour. There are also numerous restaurants and grocery stores close by to stock the fridge. Parking is free and very close to your room. The pool is small, but with the beach close by, there is no lack of water. One of the largest parks in Orange County is also only a couple of blocks away. This is no place for a romantic getaway, but if you are staying for longer periods of have kids and need a kitchen, you can't go wrong.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quiet Hotel, Close to beach & attractions
Summary: This was a very quiet hotel, I didn't even notice there were high school sports teams staying here until our last night.  We stayed 7 nights total, and enjoyed the delicious breakfast every morning.  The pool was clean and my kids loved it, especially the lights that changed color.  It was easy to find, and close to the airport, beach, freeway, Anaheim and lots of restaurants.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My older daughter and I recently stayed here to attend a conference in Huntington Beach.  We were here for 7 nights.  We extended one additional night here instead of getting a room closer to the Orange County airport.  It turns out it's only 7 miles from the airport anyway.   I am one of those people who agonize about hotel rooms and locations and particularly cleanliness and safety.  This place was just fine and I would stay there again.  The room was clean and the kitchenette was an added bonus for those days when we didn't want to eat out. The breakfast was a good start to the day. On the weekends the place is not packed and I requested a quiet room and got one in the middle of the property between the two thoroughfares.  It was relatively quiet and the the 2 bedroom suite I got was nice.  Only downsides is they have HiDef TV's with no HiDef signals so the reception is not good which is not the best for football viewing.  Breakfast was so-so.    Pro's:  Front desk kid was super nice and helped me with the internet as they have a computer that doesn't automatically go to Internet explorer.  Rooms are thermostat controlled and fans are pretty quiet.  Con's: You could get a room

Summary: My parents, daughter and I stayed in a two room suite in building 9.  Couldn't hear the freeway from the room.  Room was clean.  My daughter was sick and visited the front desk in the middle of the night for some soda and the front desk clerk was friendly and super helpful.  Would stay here again.

Summary: Musky smell the second I pushed open the door to the dark room. Stayed in building #9 facing the #405, but didn't hear the freeway. Had to unplug the loud refrigerator, and the shower streamed water all night.  Housekeeping could be improved, found traces of other visitors in the bathroom and living area. I wouldn't recommend staying here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this Residence Inn recently for 3 nights. It is a very comfortable and spacious facility for the price. The staff was great. Upon our arrival we had been flying all day. My wife wasn't feeling well and we were tired. We were assigned a room on the 2 nd floor ( no elevators) and had several bags to haul. The general manage had changed to casual clothes and was headed home for the day. He saw my wife's expression and immediately dropped his stuff to carry our bags up. Everyone we had contact with was extremely helpful and friendly. The complimentary hot breakfast was very good. Housekeeping did an excellently job. Our room was in good condition and parking was available and convenient tithe entrance. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Back to the Residence Inn standards
Summary: Have not stayed in the RI of Fountain Valley for 5 years due to previous bad experiences, it is good to see that it is back to Marriot Residence Inn standards with only a few things left to improve.  We stayed for more than a week in building 10 which faces the 405 freeway. Close the windows and you only hear big trucks using their brakes but no other traffic.  All rooms have been remodeled 2 years ago and follow the new RI color scheme. Unfortunately they have not upgraded the WiFi (slow download rates with less than 200 kB and long response times) and the TV is still analog with a limited number of channels (no Disney to the great disappointment of my daughter).  Room service was consistently good and the front desk service perfect, very polite and obliging.

Summary Heading: Great place, pricey, could be better with a little effort
Summary: Overall we enjoyed our stay here. Our main requirement was a 2 room suite - that's what we got. The living room and kitchen were great additions. The location is great - close to the 405 and easy to get to Newport and Huntington Beach, Disneyland, local restaurants and stores, and John Wayne Airport. We had family staying at nearby hotels (they only needed a single room so other places worked out better for them) and we were close to them too. The continental breakfast was fine (be warned - when they say that breakfast ends at 9:30, they mean it - all of the food is put away promptly) and they have free dinner Monday through Wednesday but we have other stuff planned so we didn't go. After unloading all luggage and kids, we can't get into our room and find someone is already there.  We had to go back to the front desk with all our stuff to find out we were given the wrong room number, twice, once on the key envelope and again on the map.  Frustrating since we lost about 20 minutes dealing with this.  First of all, these are practically apartments, the entrance to your room is on the outside, there are no hallways or elevators. Summary Heading: Like coming home to an apartment instead of to a hotel
Summary: I stayed here two weeks on business.  I had the opportunity to stay in two different types of rooms.  The first time I had a King studio which was by no means little, it was just all one big open room.  It had a full sized kitchen with full size appliances and marble/granite counters.  The furniture and fixtures were all in pretty new condition and style and the bed was reasonably comfortable.  It's a huge amount of space in comparison to any standard hotel room.  What I didn't like was that the bathroom sink which was just outside the toilet/shower room had the older (aka LOW) height counter.  This is a huge pet peeve of mine.  Why go to all the trouble to update a hotel room and leave this clearly undone.  Unfortunately this is something I find very common in Marriott family

Summary Heading: Very dog-friendly but kitchen not clean
Summary: My husband and I, and our dog, stayed two nights at this Residence Inn. The location is great. Lots of restaurants nearby, and only 5 miles to the Huntington Dog Beach. The grassy pet area in the far back corner of the property is one of the largest we've ever seen at a Residence Inn, and we really appreciated that. The breakfast buffet was good. There is a nice outdoor conversation area near a fountain.  The one drawback to our stay was that the kitchen in our suite was not very clean. The floor was a little sticky when we arrived, and every dish we took out of the cupboard needed to be re-washed by hand before we would eat off of it. I will say that the management was very responsive when we reported this to them, and they took care of it right away.
Manager Response: none
